info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 7:06AM EDT until May 13 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing.
* WHERE...Central Laurens County, South Carolina
* WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 701 AM EDT, heavy rain responsible for flash flooding has ended across Laurens County.
The majority of streams have receded from earlier flash flooding, however the Little River streamgauge at Gordon St in Laurens remains above the Action/Advisory Stage of 7.0 feet. At these levels, the lower elevations of Little River Park are flooding. Additional areas of isolated nuisance flooding are possible along Little River from Laurens and points downstream near Mountville. Therefore, the Flash Flood Warning has been replaced by a Flood Advisory, which will remain in effect until the Little River falls back below Action/Advisory Stage.
- Some locations that may continue to experience nuisance flooding include... Laurens and Mountville.
- Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING
